sentences.sContent: My husband, an otherwise sensible man, has the regrettable habit of turning on the television each and every morning, like a moth to the flame.
sentences.sCn: 我的丈夫，他在其他方面都很明智，可是有一个令人遗憾的习惯，每一天的早晨，他总是要打开电视机，就像飞蛾扑火那样。

remMethod.val: “莫死” → 不畏死 → 飞蛾(moth)扑火哪畏死

trans.tranOther: an insect related to the  butterfly  that flies mainly at night and is attracted to lights. Some moths eat holes in cloth.
